snippet: Despite improving job growth and an extended Republican primary, President Obama’s approval rating dropped substantially in recent weeks, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll shows a sharp drop in President Obama’s approval rating, despite improving job growth and an extended Republican primary season; poll provides a statistical reminder of how unsettled and unpredictable this year's political landscape remains.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and MARJORIE CONNELLY
byline.contributor: Allison Kopicki, Marina Stefan and Dalia Sussman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Despite improving job growth and an extended Republican primary, President Obama’s approval rating dropped substantially in recent weeks, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

headline.seo: Obama Approval Rating Down in New York Times/CBS Poll
headline.main: Obama’s Rating Falls as Poll Reflects Volatility
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Rating Falls as Poll Reflects Volatility
